meanings.definition: Equal in force, power, or effect.
meanings.sent1: The two teams showed equipollent strength during the match.
meanings.sent2: The scales were perfectly equipollent, ensuring a fair measurement.
meanings.sent3: The equipollent tug-of-war between the siblings over the toy was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was an equipollent force against any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The equipollent partnership between the two companies led to great success.

meanings.sent1: Both paintings were considered equipollent in the art exhibition.
meanings.sent2: The opinions of all team members were equipollent in the decision-making process.
meanings.sent3: It was quite equipollent how much the two friends loved the same movie.
meanings.sent4: Her smile held an equipollent charm to that of a movie star.
meanings.sent5: The equipollent contributions of all volunteers made the event a success.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is equivalent or comparable to another.
meanings.sent1: In the world of superheroes, he was considered an equipollent to the legendary hero.
meanings.sent2: The new smartphone model was an equipollent to its predecessor in terms of features.
meanings.sent3: The cat saw the dog as an equipollent playmate in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her best friend was an equipollent to a sister in her life.
meanings.sent5: The antique vase was an equipollent to a treasure in the collector's eyes.
